alert.note: Alert for Fulton; Henry (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 23 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Henry and Fulton Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 400 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Fayette to near Archbold to 7 miles northwest of Napoleon. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Wauseon around 415 PM EDT. Delta around 420 PM EDT. This includes Interstate 80 in Ohio between mile markers 26 and 43. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for southeastern Michigan...and northwestern Ohio.
